result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontrell Domone Dolton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontrell Domone Dolton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dontrell Domone Dolton in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Dontrell Domone Dolton in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dontrell Domone Dolton appeared by video means.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED her/his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds Remotely. 

AS TO COUNT 1 
PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 142 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 142 days time served, TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge by 2/21/2025.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 2/21/2025. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.


AS TO COUNT 2  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Dontrell Domone Dolton not in court, in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dontrell Domone Dolton
Current: 1621 N 38th St, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 03-15-2022)
Prior: 9076 East North 95th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Dontrell Domone Dolton in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dontrell Domone Dolton in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dontrell Domone Dolton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
